abstract: Mia Katigbak, stage actress and co-founder of National Asian American Theater Company, has been working hard for past 25 years to expand roles for Asian-American actors; her most recent effort, revival of Clifford Odets' 1935 play Awake and Sing! at Public Theater, will feature Asian-Americans playing characters in multigenerational Jewish family.
lead_paragraph: As the National Asian American Theater Company readies a revival of “Awake and Sing!,” a founder talks about the casting barriers her troupe is trying to surmount.

headline.main: She’ll Play the Jewish Mother, and Wants Other Asian-Americans to Get the Best Parts, Too
headline.print_headline: Rebelling at Roles Like the Korean Grocer

snippet: As the National Asian American Theater Company readies a revival of “Awake and Sing!,” a founder talks about the casting barriers her troupe is trying to surmount.
